text: What's up, outliers? Quick market recap. I want to walk through what we're seeing today, because I think a lot of people are starting to feel a little bit of pressure. So I want to talk about that. And then we're going to take a look at a little bit of GameStop, because we had an expiration today. And I will be stepping away from the daily videos for about a week. And then I'll be back online, getting right back after it towards the middle of August. So let's get into detail here. For those that don't know, I'm in the process of going through a rebrand. So you'll notice that the channel is no longer ES invests. It's outlier trading. I'm just trying to remove myself from the center of things, ESR, my initials. And I want it to be about the community. So this whole thing is grown in a completely different direction than I originally started the channel for, which was literally just sharing some information with my military friends. And I'm stoked to see it, but I want to make sure I'm moving with the way that our community is moving. So you'll notice I have a new website outlier trading dot IO. And pretty much everything else is going to be rebranded towards the outlier trading. So yeah, nothing really specific. Well, it's because as we're getting economic data that indicates economic weakness, the expectation is that big daddy J pow will then be forced to do something a little more drastic, a little faster. Because these kind of weaknesses are just showing cracks. But remember, these are all lagging indicators. So if it's not looking good now, even if we make a change right now, next month, it's not going to look good. The month after that, it's probably not going to look good. And you don't know exactly how bad it's going to get. So to me, that's also another reason why we're seeing the market behave this way. Because we've had one of the strongest first six months that we've ever seen. It was almost parabolic. The market was up the SP 500 was up almost 20 in six months. That's insane. So when we're seeing some of this weakness coming out, the market already, in my opinion, was at a point where it was very frothy. People were buying hand over fist. Things still were very uncertain, but we were kind of just following the information we had at the time. And now that we're starting to see some weakness, I think you're seeing the market react, essentially as it should. I don't even think that this is an overreaction. I've talked about them before, but I'm not long any options right now and I'm waiting to go long options. And what I'm doing is as GameStop is going down like this, I like to set alerts like this. And as I see it cross above these different thresholds, then I will consider starting to build out and add a position. But I like to wait until it's starting to move in the correct direction as compared to buying it on the way down. Because I do not know when it's going to stop. But that's me as traitor for other people, the idea is to dollar cost average in on a regular basis and that can work out really, really well. But that's what I'm looking at. As always, any questions, anything, let me know. The next live stream is tonight at 5 p.m. Pacific time. It's outlier, option trading for beginners. We got a bunch of stuff to cover there.
